messages.title: Dear Resident
messages.content: Can you remember how you felt after the referendum in June? Like most people in London, I voted for Remain and was proud to do so. As it became clear that Leave had won, I was heartbroken and fearful for our country’s future. I feared the effect Brexit would have on our economy. So many of our biggest employers - from car manufacturers to financial services - rely heavily on our close relationship with Europe. Rather than concentrate on making the best of a bad situation by safeguarding investment and jobs, the Government is dragging Britain towards the hardest possible Brexit. If the Conservatives get a huge majority on 8th June, then it will be more of the same. This election is our chance to change the direction of our country. We need a strong opposition that will stand up for our NHS and local schools - both of which face more damaging cuts under the Conservatives. Meanwhile, Jeremy Corbyn’s Labour Party are in disarray and are going backwards everywhere. They won’t even oppose leaving the single market. That’s why I’m asking for your vote. As your Lib Dem MP, I will stand up for our NHS and local schools. I will vote against any Brexit deal which makes Britain outside the single market. I will call for a referendum on the terms of any deal, with an option to remain in the EU. Give me your support and reject the politics of fear and isolation from this Conservative Government. Thank you.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Send a message on hard Brexit
keyPolicies.policyDescription: The Conservative Government is recklessly putting Britain’s economic future at risk. Their hard Brexit agenda means jobs and businesses in this country are under threat. As our next MP, Ryan Mercer will fight to protect our membership of the Single Market and ensure that young people continue to have the freedom and opportunity to live, work and travel across Europe.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Send a message on our schools
keyPolicies.policyDescription: This Conservative Government plans to cut the funding for schoolchildren in Putney by £655 per pupil. London has seen an education success story in recent years and our area has some of the best schools in the city. Rather than fighting to protect those schools, our MP is risking our children’s future. Ryan Mercer and the Liberal Democrats will lead the fight against these cuts.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Send a message on our NHS
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Our local doctors and nurses do a fantastic job but are not getting the support they need. Underinvestment in our NHS, particularly in mental health and social care provision, means growing pressure on local services such as GP surgeries and community pharmacies. Ryan Mercer will protect our local NHS. He will fight for properly funded mental health issues, particularly for those with dementia.
